benefits: Boosts energy; Improves immunity; Anti-aging; Adaptogenic
description: Ginseng is one of the most revered herbs in Traditional Chinese Medicine. It is considered a powerful adaptogen that helps the body adapt to stress.

description: Ginger is a warming herb in TCM that helps dispel cold and improve digestion. It is commonly used for nausea and digestive issues.

diseases: Eye problems; Aging; Weak immunity; Fatigue
description: Goji berries are considered a superfood in TCM. They are known for their nourishing properties and ability to support eye health.

benefits: Supports immunity; Anti-aging; Energy booster; Adaptogenic
diseases: Weak immunity; Aging; Fatigue; Respiratory issues
description: Astragalus is a key herb in TCM for supporting the immune system. It is often used to strengthen the body's defensive qi.

diseases: Weak immunity; Aging; Stress; Sleep issues
description: Reishi mushroom is known as the 'mushroom of immortality' in TCM. It is used for its calming and immune-supporting properties.
Schisandra is a five-flavor berry in TCM that supports liver health and helps the body adapt to stress.

diseases: Sore throat; Adrenal fatigue; Digestive issues; Cough
description: Licorice is known as the 'great harmonizer' in TCM. It helps balance other herbs and soothes the throat and digestive system.

description: Chrysanthemum is a cooling herb in TCM that helps clear heat and supports eye health. It is commonly used in tea form.

description: Peony is a blood-nourishing herb in TCM that helps calm the spirit and relieve pain. It is commonly used for women's health.
